tags.name: Attachments
tags.description: Create, get and permanently delete attachments associated with work items

tags.name: Queries
tags.description:
The queries in a team project are organized in folders.

A sample structure of queries and folders might appear as shown here.

* **My Queries**
* **Shared Queries**
  * Feedback (Query)
    * **Current Sprint**
      * Blocked Tasks (Query)
      * Open Impediments (Query)
      * Test Cases (Query)
      * Unfinished Work (Query)
      * Work in Progress (Query)

tags.name: Reporting Work Item Links
tags.description:
This API provides access to all work item links in your project or collection and allows you to build a warehouse.

The response of the API contains a batch of work item links ("values"), a URL to the next batch of work item links ("nextLink") and a boolean that tells you whether you have read all currently available work item links ("isLastBatch").

The workflow for building your warehouse is as follows:
  1. Make a request to the API without providing a watermark parameter
  2. Process the work item links returned by the API
  3. Persist "nextLink" and check "isLastBatch"
    * If "isLastBatch" is true, pause for a period of time (varies depending on your target latency)
  4. Make the next request using the URL from "nextLink"
  5. Go to step 2

tags.name: Reporting Work Item Revisions
tags.description:
This API provides access to all work item revisions in your project or collection and allows you to build a warehouse. The response of the API contains a batch of work item revisions("values"), a URL to the next batch of work item revisions("nextLink") and a boolean that tells you whether you have read all currently available work item revisions("isLastBatch"). The workflow for building your warehouse is as follows: 1. Make a request to the API without providing a continuationToken parameter 2. Process the work item revisions returned by the API 3. Persist "nextLink" and check "isLastBatch" * If "isLastBatch" is true, pause for a period of time(varies depending on your target latency) 4. Make the next request using the URL from "nextLink" 5. Go to step 2 ## Note The results of this API are impacted when using Move Work Item and/or Change Work Item Type features in conjunction with "project" in the url and/or "types" in the query string.
- Project-scoped requests will only return work item revisions from the specified project. - Types-scoped requests will only return work item revisions of the specified type(s) ## Sample Projects [C# Example](https://github.com/sferg-msft/vsts-wit-reporting-example)

tags.name: Revisions
tags.description: This controller version exists to support returning identity values and project scoped urls for work items

tags.name: Tags
tags.description:
Tags provide ability to manage the tags for the project. 
Third party services or users with read or write permission in the work item can
list, get, update and delete tags. The tags are shared between Work Items and Pull Requests
and are used to provide quick insights into both, an example
can be labelling a Pull Request as "WIP", "Feature", or "Bug" to let others
know the state and purpose of the Pull Request.

As the tags are shared betweek Work Items and Pull Requests, then any change (update or delete) is reflected
in both. Deleting the tag will remove the tag from all Work Items as well as remove the label (tag) from the Pull Request.

tags.name: Temp Queries
tags.description: Temporary query API. Temporary queries are used to save a specific wiql for a short time

tags.name: Updates
tags.description: This controller version exists to support returning identity values and project scoped urls for work items

tags.name: Wiql
tags.description:
The WIQL API is used to run a query given the WIQL text or a saved query ID.

Learn more about Work Item Query Language (WIQL) syntax [here](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/vsts/collaborate/wiql-syntax?toc=/vsts/work/track/toc.json&bc=/vsts/work/track/breadcrumb/toc.json&view=vsts).

post.description:
Uploads an attachment.

On accounts with higher attachment upload limits (>130MB), you will need to use chunked upload.
To upload an attachment in multiple chunks, you first need to [**Start a Chunked Upload**](#start_a_chunked_upload) and then follow the example from the **Upload Chunk** section.

parameters.description: The name of the Azure DevOps organization.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Stream to upload

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: Project ID or project name

parameters.name: fileName
parameters.description: The name of the file

parameters.name: uploadType
parameters.description: Attachment upload type: Simple or Chunked

parameters.name: areaPath
parameters.description: Target project Area Path

parameters.description: The name of the Azure DevOps organization.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Attachment ID

put.description:
Uploads an attachment chunk.

Before performing [**Upload a Chunk**](#upload-a-chunk), make sure to have an attachment id returned in **Start a Chunked Upload** example on **Create** section. Specify the byte range of the chunk using Content-Length. For example: "Content - Length": "bytes 0 - 39999 / 50000" for the first 40000 bytes of a 50000 byte file.

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The name of the Azure DevOps organization.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Stream to upload

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the attachment

parameters.name: contentRangeHeader
parameters.description: starting and ending byte positions for chunked file upload, format is "Content-Range": "bytes 0-10000/50000"

parameters.description: A list of types to filter the results to specific work item types. Omit this parameter to get work item links of all work item types.

parameters.name: continuationToken
parameters.description: Specifies the continuationToken to start the batch from. Omit this parameter to get the first batch of links.

parameters.name: startDateTime
parameters.description: Date/time to use as a starting point for link changes. Only link changes that occurred after that date/time will be returned. Cannot be used in conjunction with 'watermark' parameter.

get.description: Get a batch of work item revisions with the option of including deleted items
get.operationId: Reporting Work Item Revisions_Read Reporting Revisions Get

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The name of the Azure DevOps organization.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: Project ID or project name

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: A list of fields to return in work item revisions. Omit this parameter to get all reportable fields.

parameters.name: types
parameters.description: A list of types to filter the results to specific work item types. Omit this parameter to get work item revisions of all work item types.

parameters.name: continuationToken
parameters.description: Specifies the watermark to start the batch from. Omit this parameter to get the first batch of revisions.

parameters.name: startDateTime
parameters.description: Date/time to use as a starting point for revisions, all revisions will occur after this date/time. Cannot be used in conjunction with 'watermark' parameter.

parameters.name: includeIdentityRef
parameters.description: Return an identity reference instead of a string value for identity fields.

parameters.name: includeDeleted
parameters.description: Specify if the deleted item should be returned.

parameters.name: includeTagRef
parameters.description: Specify if the tag objects should be returned for System.Tags field.

parameters.name: includeLatestOnly
parameters.description: Return only the latest revisions of work items, skipping all historical revisions

parameters.name: $expand
parameters.description: Return all the fields in work item revisions, including long text fields which are not returned by default

parameters.name: includeDiscussionChangesOnly
parameters.description: Return only the those revisions of work items, where only history field was changed

parameters.name: $maxPageSize
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to return in this batch

post.description: Get a batch of work item revisions. This request may be used if your list of fields is large enough that it may run the URL over the length limit.
post.operationId: Reporting Work Item Revisions_Read Reporting Revisions Post

delete.description: Deletes the specified work item and sends it to the Recycle Bin, so that it can be restored back, if required. Optionally, if the destroy parameter has been set to true, it destroys the work item permanently. WARNING: If the destroy parameter is set to true, work items deleted by this command will NOT go to recycle-bin and there is no way to restore/recover them after deletion. It is recommended NOT to use this parameter. If you do, please use this parameter with extreme caution.

parameters.description: The name of the Azure DevOps organization.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the work item to be deleted

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: Project ID or project name

parameters.name: destroy
parameters.description: Optional parameter, if set to true, the work item is deleted permanently. Please note: the destroy action is PERMANENT and cannot be undone.

post.description: Deletes specified work items and sends them to the Recycle Bin, so that it can be restored back, if required. Optionally, if the destroy parameter has been set to true, it destroys the work item permanently. WARNING: If the destroy parameter is set to true, work items deleted by this command will NOT go to recycle-bin and there is no way to restore/recover them after deletion.

parameters.description: Depth of children to fetch.

parameters.name: errorPolicy
parameters.description: Flag to handle errors in getting some nodes. Possible options are Fail and Omit.

querySizeLimitExceeded.description: True, when length of WorkItemDetails is same as the limit

activityDate.description: Date of the last Activity by the user

changedDate.description: Last changed date of the work item

identityId.description: TeamFoundationId of the user this activity belongs to

teamProject.description: Team project the work item belongs to

mentionedDateField.description: Latest date that the user were mentioned

teamProject.description: Team project the work item belongs to

ArtifactUriQuery.description: Contains criteria for querying work items based on artifact URI.

artifactUris.description: List of artifact URIs to use for querying work items.

ArtifactUriQueryResult.description: Defines result of artifact URI query on work items. Contains mapping of work item IDs to artifact URI.

artifactUrisQueryResult.description: A Dictionary that maps a list of work item references to the given list of artifact URI.

createdBy.description: IdentityRef of the creator of the comment.

createdDate.description: The creation date of the comment.

createdOnBehalfDate.description: Effective Date/time value for adding the comment. Can be optionally different from CreatedDate.

createdOnBehalfOf.description: Identity on whose behalf this comment has been added. Can be optionally different from CreatedBy.

format.description: Represents the possible types for the comment format.

id.description: The id assigned to the comment.

isDeleted.description: Indicates if the comment has been deleted.

modifiedBy.description: IdentityRef of the user who last modified the comment.

modifiedDate.description: The last modification date of the comment.

renderedText.description: The text of the comment in HTML format.

version.description: The current version of the comment.

workItemId.description: The id of the work item this comment belongs to.

CommentCreate.description: Represents a request to create a work item comment.

CommentList.description: Represents a list of work item comments.

comments.description: List of comments in the current batch.

continuationToken.description: A string token that can be used to retrieving next page of comments if available. Otherwise null.

count.description: The count of comments in the current batch.

nextPage.description: Uri to the next page of comments if it is available. Otherwise null.

totalCount.description: Total count of comments on a work item.

artifactId.description: The artifact portion of the parsed text. (i.e. the work item's id)

artifactType.description: The type the parser assigned to the mention. (i.e. person, work item, etc)

commentId.description: The comment id of the mention.

targetId.description: The resolved target of the mention. An example of this could be a user's tfid

CommentReaction.description: Contains information about work item comment reaction for a particular reaction type.

commentId.description: The id of the comment this reaction belongs to.

count.description: Total number of reactions for the CommentReactionType.

isCurrentUserEngaged.description: Flag to indicate if the current user has engaged on this particular EngagementType (e.g. if they liked the associated comment).

CommentUpdate.description: Represents a request to update a work item comment.

text.description: The updated text of the comment.

CommentVersion.description: Represents a specific version of a comment on a work item.

createdBy.description: IdentityRef of the creator of the comment.

createdDate.description: The creation date of the comment.

createdOnBehalfDate.description: Effective Date/time value for adding the comment. Can be optionally different from CreatedDate.

createdOnBehalfOf.description: Identity on whose behalf this comment has been added. Can be optionally different from CreatedBy.

id.description: The id assigned to the comment.

isDeleted.description: Indicates if the comment has been deleted at this version.

modifiedBy.description: IdentityRef of the user who modified the comment at this version.

modifiedDate.description: The modification date of the comment for this version.

renderedText.description: The rendered content of the comment at this version.

text.description: The text of the comment at this version.

DestroyedAttachment.description: Describes permanently deleted attachment and work items that had links to this attachment.

affectedWorkItems.description: Work items with attachment references that have been marked as deleted.

FieldDependentRule.description: Describes a list of dependent fields for a rule.

FieldUpdate.description: Describes an update request for a work item field.

isDeleted.description: Indicates whether the user wants to restore the field.

isLocked.description: Indicates whether the user wants to lock the field.

authorizationType.description: Github connection authorization type (f. e. PAT, OAuth)

isConnectionValid.description: Whether current Github connection is valid or not

name.description: Github connection name (should contain organization/user name)

GitHubConnectionReposBatchRequest.description: Describes Github connection's repo bulk request

_links.description: This field contains zero or more interesting links about the graph subject. These links may be invoked to obtain additional relationships or more detailed information about this graph subject.

descriptor.description: The descriptor is the primary way to reference the graph subject while the system is running. This field will uniquely identify the same graph subject across both Accounts and Organizations.

displayName.description: This is the non-unique display name of the graph subject. To change this field, you must alter its value in the source provider.

url.description: This url is the full route to the source resource of this graph subject.

directoryAlias.description: Deprecated - Can be retrieved by querying the Graph user referenced in the "self" entry of the IdentityRef "_links" dictionary

imageUrl.description: Deprecated - Available in the "avatar" entry of the IdentityRef "_links" dictionary

inactive.description: Deprecated - Can be retrieved by querying the Graph membership state referenced in the "membershipState" entry of the GraphUser "_links" dictionary

isAadIdentity.description: Deprecated - Can be inferred from the subject type of the descriptor (Descriptor.IsAadUserType/Descriptor.IsAadGroupType)

isContainer.description: Deprecated - Can be inferred from the subject type of the descriptor (Descriptor.IsGroupType)

profileUrl.description: Deprecated - not in use in most preexisting implementations of ToIdentityRef

IdentityReference.description: Describes a reference to an identity.

id.description: Gets or sets the identifier of the identity.

name.description: Legacy back-compat property. This has been the WIT specific value from Constants. Will be hidden (but exists) on the client unless they are targeting the newest version

JsonPatchDocument.description: The JSON model for JSON Patch Operations

JsonPatchOperation.description: The JSON model for a JSON Patch operation

from.description: The path to copy from for the Move/Copy operation.

path.description: The path for the operation. In the case of an array, a zero based index can be used to specify the position in the array (e.g. /biscuits/0/name). The "-" character can be used instead of an index to insert at the end of the array (e.g. /biscuits/-).

value.description: The value for the operation. This is either a primitive or a JToken.

body.description: The mail body in HTML format.

ProcessMigrationResultModel.description: Stores project ID and its process ID.

ProjectWorkItemStateColors.description: Project work item type state colors

workItemTypeStateColors.description: State colors for all work item type in a project

ProvisioningResult.description: Result of an update work item type XML update operation.

provisioningImportEvents.description: Details about of the provisioning import events.

Displays minimal properties and the WIQL text

errorPolicy.description: The flag to control error policy in a query batch request. Possible options are { Fail, Omit }.

QueryHierarchyItem.description: Represents an item in the work item query hierarchy. This can be either a query or a folder.

children.description: The child query items inside a query folder.

clauses.description: The clauses for a flat query.

createdBy.description: The identity who created the query item.

createdDate.description: When the query item was created.

values.description: Returns flat list of work items.
Returns work items where the source, target, and link criteria are all satisfied.
Returns work items that satisfy the source and link criteria, even if no linked work item satisfies the target criteria.
Returns work items that satisfy the source, only if no linked work item satisfies the link and target criteria.
Returns work items a hierarchy of work items that by default satisfy the source

hasChildren.description: If this is a query folder, indicates if it contains any children.

id.description: The id of the query item.

isDeleted.description: Indicates if this query item is deleted. Setting this to false on a deleted query item will undelete it. Undeleting a query or folder will not bring back the permission changes that were previously applied to it.

isFolder.description: Indicates if this is a query folder or a query.

isInvalidSyntax.description: Indicates if the WIQL of this query is invalid. This could be due to invalid syntax or a no longer valid area/iteration path.

isPublic.description: Indicates if this query item is public or private.

lastExecutedBy.description: The identity who last ran the query.

lastExecutedDate.description: When the query was last run.

lastModifiedBy.description: The identity who last modified the query item.

lastModifiedDate.description: When the query item was last modified.

name.description: The name of the query item.

path.description: The path of the query item.

queryRecursionOption.description: The recursion option for use in a tree query.

values.description: Returns work items that satisfy the source, even if no linked work item satisfies the target and link criteria.
Returns work items that satisfy the target criteria, even if no work item satisfies the source and link criteria.
Gets a flat list of work items.
Gets a tree of work items showing their link hierarchy.
Gets a list of work items and their direct links.

sortColumns.description: The sort columns of the query.

sourceClauses.description: The source clauses in a tree or one-hop link query.

targetClauses.description: The target clauses in a tree or one-hop link query.

wiql.description: The WIQL text of the query

hasMore.description: Indicates if the max return limit was hit but there are still more items

ReferenceLinks.description: The class to represent a collection of REST reference links.

links.description: The readonly view of the links.  Because Reference links are readonly, we only want to expose them as read only.

ReportingWorkItemRevisionsFilter.description: The class represents the reporting work item revision filer.

fields.description: A list of fields to return in work item revisions. Omit this parameter to get all reportable fields.

includeDeleted.description: Include deleted work item in the result.

includeIdentityRef.description: Return an identity reference instead of a string value for identity fields.

includeLatestOnly.description: Include only the latest version of a work item, skipping over all previous revisions of the work item.

includeTagRef.description: Include tag reference instead of string value for System.Tags field

types.description: A list of types to filter the results to specific work item types. Omit this parameter to get work item revisions of all work item types.

StreamedBatch.description: The class describes reporting work item revision batch.

continuationToken.description: ContinuationToken acts as a waterMark. Used while querying large results.

isLastBatch.description: Returns 'true' if it's last batch, 'false' otherwise.

nextLink.description: The next link for the work item.

values.description: Values such as rel, sourceId, TargetId, ChangedDate, isActive.

TeamContext.description: The Team Context for an operation.

project.description: The team project Id or name.  Ignored if ProjectId is set.

team.description: The Team Id or name.  Ignored if TeamId is set.

api-Version-preview.1.name: api-version
api-Version-preview.1.description: Version of the API to use.  This should be set to '7.2-preview.1' to use this version of the api.

api-Version-preview.2.name: api-version

accessToken.description: Personal access token. Use any value for the user name and the token as the password.

scopes.vso.githubconnections_manage: Grants the ability to read and manage github connections and github repositories data
scopes.vso.githubconnections: Grants the ability to read github connections and github repositories data
scopes.vso.work: Grants the ability to read work items, queries, boards, area and iterations paths, and other work item tracking related metadata. Also grants the ability to execute queries, search work items and to receive notifications about work item events via service hooks.
scopes.vso.work_write: Grants the ability to read, create, and update work items and queries, update board metadata, read area and iterations paths other work item tracking related metadata, execute queries, and to receive notifications about work item events via service hooks.
scopes.vso.work_full: Grants full access to work items, queries, backlogs, plans, and work item tracking metadata. Also provides the ability to receive notifications about work item events via service hooks.
